intro: Mosquitoxylum jamaicense, commonly known as the Jamaican mosquito plant, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean, particularly Jamaica. It belongs to the family Meliaceae, which includes mahogany and related trees. The plant is characterized by its small, green, heart-shaped leaves and clusters of yellowish-white flowers. It thrives in humid, tropical climates and is often found in moist, shaded areas within forests. The plant's name reflects its historical use in repelling mosquitoes due to its aromatic properties.
